paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant Val122Ile, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The Val122Ile mutation, a common form of ATTR-v CA, is seen in 3–4% of the African–Caribbean population.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile variant leads to misfolding of the TTR protein, contributing to amyloid deposition.
assays: Functional assays measuring amyloid fibril formation

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with a higher prevalence of ATTR-CA in specific populations.
key_quotes: The prevalence of ATTR cardiac amyloidosis (ATTR-CA) is higher in males, particularly among older patients with the wild-type form and those with hereditary variants, such as the Val122Ile mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text, focusing on the TTR gene.
